chapter.title: Deployers
chapter.para: The deployer chains for the project is located in the deployers module.

section.title: RAR Deployer
section.para: The responsibility of the RAR deployer is to deploy a resource adapter archive (.RAR) file.

section.title: Fungal
section.para: The Fungal kernel features a simple deployment framework, so only three classes are needed for the deployer chain.
The classes are located in the
directory.

section.title: RADeployer
section.para: This class represent a resource adapter deployer and implements the
interface.
The responsible of the class is to

itemizedlist.listitem: Create a classloader for the deployment
Retrieve metadata and annotations such that they can be merged
Perform archive validation using the JCA validator
Register the metadata in the metadata repository
Identify and activate the resource adapter objects - if JNDI information is available
Bind connection factories and admin objects into JNDI - if JNDI information is available

section.title: RADeployment
section.para: This class represent a resource adapter deployment and implements the
interface.
The responsible of the class is to

itemizedlist.listitem: Unbind connection factories and admin objects in JNDI - if the deployment was activated

section.title: RAActivator
section.para: This class will activate all resource adapters which hasn't been deployed by a previous step. The class implements the
interface. This interface allows the class to hook into the deployer lifecycle of the kernel and receive callback notifications.
The responsible of the class is to

itemizedlist.listitem: Find any resource adapters which hasn't been deployed through the metadata repository
Register each deployment with the kernel through the main deployer

section.title: DataSource Deployer
section.para: The responsibility of the datasource deployer is to deploy a datasource deployment (-ds.xml) file.
